title: Matthew Perry's death: How 'Friends' actor was exploited in $55,000 Ketamine drug scheme
Vice presidential showdown: Vance and Walz confirm Oct 1 debate
content: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Ohio Senator JD Vance confirmed their participation in a vice presidential debate on October 1. The debate, mediated by CBS News, saw both campaigns agreeing only to this date. Vance emphasized the necessity of multiple debates but avoided committing to any additional engagements proposed by CNN and others.
summary: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz and Ohio Senator JD Vance confirmed their participation in a vice presidential debate on October 1. The debate, mediated by CBS News, saw both campaigns agreeing only to this date. Vance emphasized the necessity of multiple debates but avoided committing to any additional engagements proposed by CNN and others.

title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle’s Colombian visit: What to expect
content: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle received a warm welcome in Colombia on August 15, starting their visit with a meeting with Vice President Francia Marquez. Their engagements focus on mental health and digital safety, including activities with local organizations, youth groups, and a summit on digital safety. They also plan to visit Cartagena and Cali.
summary: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle received a warm welcome in Colombia on August 15, starting their visit with a meeting with Vice President Francia Marquez. Their engagements focus on mental health and digital safety, including activities with local organizations, youth groups, and a summit on digital safety. They also plan to visit Cartagena and Cali.

title: North Korea's Kim and Russia's Putin vow deeper ties on Korean liberation day
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un pledged to deepen ties with Russia in response to Vladimir Putin's message on the anniversary of Korea's liberation from Japan. Kim emphasized the historical bond between their countries and highlighted the comprehensive strategic partnership signed recently. He also commemorated Korean and Soviet soldiers who fought against Japan during World War Two.
summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un pledged to deepen ties with Russia in response to Vladimir Putin's message on the anniversary of Korea's liberation from Japan. Kim emphasized the historical bond between their countries and highlighted the comprehensive strategic partnership signed recently. He also commemorated Korean and Soviet soldiers who fought against Japan during World War Two.

title: US elections: Trump claims, 'I am entitled to attack Harris personally because ...'
South Korea records longest streak of 'tropical nights,' breaks 118 years record
content: South Korea experienced an unprecedented heatwave, breaking a 118-year record with 26 tropical nights in a row, with temperatures consistently above 25°C. Seoul marked the longest period of extreme heat since 1907, surpassing the 2018 record. Busan also endured 21 consecutive tropical nights, matching previous records set in 1994 and 2018.
summary: South Korea experienced an unprecedented heatwave, breaking a 118-year record with 26 tropical nights in a row, with temperatures consistently above 25°C. Seoul marked the longest period of extreme heat since 1907, surpassing the 2018 record. Busan also endured 21 consecutive tropical nights, matching previous records set in 1994 and 2018.

title: Large presence of Indian Americans likely at Democratic convention, says fund raiser Ajay Bhutoria
After Sweden, more cases of mpox to come in Europe: WHO
content: The WHO on Thursday warned further imported cases of the new, more dangerous mpox strain in Europe were likely, after Sweden announced the first such infection outside Africa in an outbreak that has killed hundreds in the DR Congo. The case recorded in a traveller in Sweden was announced the day after the World Health Organization declared the mpox surge in Africa a public health emergency of international concern -- the highest alarm it can sound.
summary: The WHO on Thursday warned further imported cases of the new, more dangerous mpox strain in Europe were likely, after Sweden announced the first such infection outside Africa in an outbreak that has killed hundreds in the DR Congo. The case recorded in a traveller in Sweden was announced the day after the World Health Organization declared the mpox surge in Africa a public health emergency of international concern -- the highest alarm it can sound.

title: 5, including assistant and doctors, charged in Matthew Perry’s fatal ketamine overdose case
Day two of Gaza ceasefire talks under way in Doha; Hamas skips meet
content: Negotiations aimed at fostering peace between Israel and Hamas through a Gaza ceasefire agreement were set to resume today. US officials termed Thursday's discussions in Doha as constructive. Talks involving CIA Director William Burns aim to end the ongoing conflict, which has resulted in a humanitarian crisis and a high death toll in Gaza.
summary: Negotiations aimed at fostering peace between Israel and Hamas through a Gaza ceasefire agreement were set to resume today. US officials termed Thursday's discussions in Doha as constructive. Talks involving CIA Director William Burns aim to end the ongoing conflict, which has resulted in a humanitarian crisis and a high death toll in Gaza.

title: Watch: Joe Biden and Kamal Harris heckled by Anti-Israel protestors
content: During President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris's first joint address since Biden announced his 2024 candidacy, anti-Israel protesters disrupted the event in Prince George’s County, Maryland. Despite the commotion, Biden continued his speech, humorously acknowledging his age and referring to former President Trump as “Donald Dump.” Harris praised Biden, expressing strong support for his presidency.
summary: During President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris's first joint address since Biden announced his 2024 candidacy, anti-Israel protesters disrupted the event in Prince George’s County, Maryland. Despite the commotion, Biden continued his speech, humorously acknowledging his age and referring to former President Trump as “Donald Dump.” Harris praised Biden, expressing strong support for his presidency.

title: Biden and Kamala make joint appearance, first since Biden dropped out of presidential race
content: US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris made their first joint public appearance in Maryland, marking a significant Democratic transition. Biden highlighted his achievements in reducing prescription drug prices, while Harris energized the crowd, emphasizing the impact of these policies. Harris secured the Democratic nomination for president with Tim Walz as her running mate.
summary: US President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris made their first joint public appearance in Maryland, marking a significant Democratic transition. Biden highlighted his achievements in reducing prescription drug prices, while Harris energized the crowd, emphasizing the impact of these policies. Harris secured the Democratic nomination for president with Tim Walz as her running mate.

title: Hurricane Ernesto: Bermuda on alert as storm grows stronger, power outages and flooding continue in Puerto Rico
content: Hurricane Ernesto, a Category 1 storm, is intensifying towards Bermuda. It caused heavy damage in Puerto Rico, leaving many without power. The National Hurricane Center anticipated Ernesto could become a major hurricane by Friday. Residents in Bermuda were advised to prepare for strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges over the weekend.
summary: Hurricane Ernesto, a Category 1 storm, is intensifying towards Bermuda. It caused heavy damage in Puerto Rico, leaving many without power. The National Hurricane Center anticipated Ernesto could become a major hurricane by Friday. Residents in Bermuda were advised to prepare for strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges over the weekend.

title: 6.1-magnitude earthquake shakes Taiwan: USGS
content: A 6.1-magnitude earthquake struck off Taiwan’s east coast near Hualien early Friday morning. Initially reported as magnitude 6.3, the tremor occurred at a depth of 15 kilometers. Mobile alerts advised people to stay calm and seek cover. Authorities confirmed no immediate damage. Taiwan frequently experiences earthquakes due to its tectonic location.
summary: A 6.1-magnitude earthquake struck off Taiwan’s east coast near Hualien early Friday morning. Initially reported as magnitude 6.3, the tremor occurred at a depth of 15 kilometers. Mobile alerts advised people to stay calm and seek cover. Authorities confirmed no immediate damage. Taiwan frequently experiences earthquakes due to its tectonic location.

title: Netanyahu rejects claims of discussing Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal with Trump
US arrests reputed Peruvian gang leader wanted for 23 killings in his home country
content: Gianfranco Torres-Navarro, the leader of the Peruvian gang 'Los Killers' and wanted for 23 killings, was arrested by US immigration authorities in New York. Torres-Navarro entered the US illegally and was detained at a facility in Buffalo. His girlfriend, Michelle Sol Ivanna Ortiz Ubillus, was also arrested and is being held in Pennsylvania.
summary: Gianfranco Torres-Navarro, the leader of the Peruvian gang 'Los Killers' and wanted for 23 killings, was arrested by US immigration authorities in New York. Torres-Navarro entered the US illegally and was detained at a facility in Buffalo. His girlfriend, Michelle Sol Ivanna Ortiz Ubillus, was also arrested and is being held in Pennsylvania.

title: US and allies push for ceasefire as talks resume
content: The United States announced a promising start to ceasefire talks in Gaza, led by CIA Director William Burns in Doha, Qatar. The discussions aim to end the conflict that has claimed over 40,000 lives and caused severe humanitarian issues. Hamas did not participate initially but is ready if new commitments are achieved from Israel.
summary: The United States announced a promising start to ceasefire talks in Gaza, led by CIA Director William Burns in Doha, Qatar. The discussions aim to end the conflict that has claimed over 40,000 lives and caused severe humanitarian issues. Hamas did not participate initially but is ready if new commitments are achieved from Israel.
